attributes.comment:
CMS-0058-NC
When I have searched for providers, it is often important that I have the opportunity to select a provider by their sex/gender. This has been important because of interactions with people especially of the opposite gender and the type of relationship I want to be able to have with a medical provider. The gender listed for the provider is called "Administrative gender" and is not otherwise defined by HL7 or FHIR. Currently activists and the US government and other governments, are effacing the facts of our biology in favor of an individual's preference for another gender. I would ask that the group creating this directory should be very clear that a person's gender (calling it birth gender is nonsensical) is clearly identified. As a patient it is my right to be able to find a provider who is in fact the gender that they claim to be. There are multiple ways to express gender in HL7 and this group could allow those different with a clear meaning. This would make it easy for everyone to understand what their provider is, in a fundamental way. What I am asking is that the gender be defined clearly and if necessary an alternate gender expression can be provided so that a patient who is looking for a provider could easily see the gender and also see if that person likes to be viewed as the other sex/gender.
